data.title: Made the tech description label optional
data.body: It is inconsistent to use `GetOrNull` and then crash on the null state which was picked up by Coverity.

data.title: Fixed an explicit NRE from SwallowActor.WormAttack
data.body: I guess the only reason this didn't blow already is that the sandworms don't have the `AmmoPool` trait attached.

data.title: Grenadiers have no attack voice when trained as ordos (and possibly hark)
Fixed a division through zero
data.body: This is probably just a theoretical problem as zero occupied cells generally doesn't make much sense.

data.title: Fremen sometimes uses atreides engineer voice when selected
data.body: This was from content from CD (North American release).

data.title: Ingame Map Editor : Forbid to place several actors on the same location
data.body:
The ingame map editor allows to place several actors on the same location, resulting in having overlapping tanks for example.

While it could be interesting to have 3 or 5 infantry units at the same location, it doesn't make sense for tanks or other vehicles.. Maybe the sidebar could offer: 1 infantry unit, 3 infantry units and 5 infantry units to be placed?

http://logs.openra.net/?year=2015&month=05&day=31#16:34:06

data.title: Fixed an explicit NRE in TerrainModifiesDamage
data.body: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Activities/Demolish.cs#L70 sets warhead to null so it will crash here. I believe this is a real vulnerability introduced by https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7331.

data.title: Add a lint check for actor upgrades
data.body:
While this doesn't check whether actor A that grants upgrade X and actor B that uses it can actually interact ingame, it does check whether:
- All upgrades that can be granted by various sources have at least one actor that uses them.
- All upgrades that are consumed by any actor have at least one source to grant them.

It also adds a proxy trait that allows Lua scripts to declare in YAML what custom upgrades they will be using (this enables validation of Lua-granted upgrades).

The main purpose is to close #8272 by checking for unused upgrades, spelling errors and upgrades that nothing can grant.

Closes #8272.

I strongly recommend reviewing per-commit!

data.title: Fixed a possible NRE in FlyAttack.Tick
data.body: For some reason AttackPlane is optional here (TraitOrDefault). Either way we can't check at compile time if the trait dependency is full-filled so another null check will avoid a crash. Discovered by Coverity.

data.title: Fixed possible NREs in AI.StateMachine
data.body: Discovered by Coverity.

data.title: Fixed possible NREs in HackyAI.Damaged
data.body: Coverity is complaining here. The null check is far too late (or even unnecessary). I decided to move it up for extra safety.

data.title: "Sand Shores"
data.body: Currently in D2k, the worms can attack on tiles that are slightly covered by rock (transitioning from sand to rock). The animation not only looks really bad, but as there is rock, my first intuition is that the worm should not be able to attack there. Perhaps these tiles should be changed so that they are neither buildable nor shai-hulud territory?

data.title: Added missing disposings of the *LoadScreen base class
data.body: `BlankLoadScreen.Dispose` is empty at the moment, so nothing bad has happened yet. Still Coverity marks it as a class hierarchy inconsistency that will lead to errors when expanded.

data.title: Fixed a possible NRE in Health.InflictDamage debug logging
data.body: This fixes a possible NRE or the null check in line 146 is superfluous. Discovered by Coverity.

data.title: Game crashes when opened
data.body: so i opened the game when i downloaded it and it worked fine then i got off then tried to open it an hour later and it loads the screen goes black then white and then crashes comes up with openRA has stopped working then a little box saying openRA closed from a fatel error view logs FAQ's and quit. i don't understand, so i restarted my computer and when i opened it when my com rebooted it worked again ???? then i got out of it went to work came back tried to open it a 2nd time crashed, i just tried to open it after a restart and it crashed please help!

data.title: Automatized Coverity Scan with AppVeyor
data.body: Note: this is not final. I just have no other way to test it than file a pull request.

data.title: Fixed a cryptic error message when feeding non-paletted PNGs into the command line utility
data.body: This was detected by Coverity as accessing a null array which will throw. This throws before this can happen with an error message that is easier to understand.

data.title: Fixed a resource leak in PngLoader
data.body: As detected by Coverity. It doesn't really matter though as this was only used in our command line utility.

data.title: Fixed a possible NRE in WRange.TryParse
data.body: Coverity detected that FieldLoader could forward a null value here. This adds extra safety.

data.title: Added a lint rule to check if Neutral is set up correctly
data.body: Closes #8269

data.title: Added a lint check for invalid owners
data.body: To automatically detect the issue resolved by https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8302.

data.title: reorder infantry build palette in TS mod
data.body: The order is not the same as the original one (influenced by dependencies) but the main point is to have standard infantry (E1) first, E2 second, ENGINEER third, and the special units on last places. The biggest difference to the original is GDI MEDIC as last (which also applies when both GDI and NOD units are available).

data.title: Some cells are not being overwritten while holding down the left mouse button and dragging
data.body:
In playtest-20150524 when I try to overwrite land tiles with a 2x2 water piece by holding down the left mouse button and dragging the mouse over the screen, some cells are being left out (i.e. they don't turn into water). Even going back with the mouse (before lifting the left mouse button) doesn't make the cell turn. This happens even if I drag the mouse slowly. Starting all over after by lifting the mouse button, holding it down again and dragging works though.
This problem only occurs in the new ingame-editor for me.

Another problem which also appears in the old extern map editor is that some cells are being left out when I move the mouse too fast.

I am on KDE 4.10.5.

data.title: Actor does not define a death animation in Tiberian Dawn Storm the Beachhead GDI mission
data.body:
Start in Tiberian Dawn mod. Play singleplayer (first) GDI mission Storm the Beachhead. Soon after start of the mission, the game crashes with `Actor type e1 does not define a death animation for weapon with damage types Prone50Percent, TriggerProne`.

This is my `exception.log`:

```
Tiberian Dawn Mod at Version playtest-20150524
Operating System: Linux (Unix 3.16.0.38)
Runtime Version: Mono 3.2.8 (Debian 3.2.8+dfsg-4ubuntu2.1) CLR 4.0.30319.17020
Exception of type `System.Exception`: Actor type `e1` does not define a death animation for weapon with damage types `Prone50Percent, TriggerProne`!
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.WithDeathAnimation.Killed (OpenRA.Actor self, OpenRA.Traits.AttackInfo e) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Traits.Health.InflictDamage (OpenRA.Actor self, OpenRA.Actor attacker, Int32 damage, OpenRA.GameRules.DamageWarhead warhead, Boolean ignoreModifiers) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Traits.HealthExts.InflictDamage (OpenRA.Actor self, OpenRA.Actor attacker, Int32 damage, OpenRA.GameRules.DamageWarhead warhead) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.GameRules.DamageWarhead.DoImpact (OpenRA.Actor victim, OpenRA.Actor firedBy, IEnumerable`1 damageModifiers) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Warheads.SpreadDamageWarhead.DoImpact (WPos pos, OpenRA.Actor firedBy, IEnumerable`1 damageModifiers) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.GameRules.DamageWarhead.DoImpact (Target target, OpenRA.Actor firedBy, IEnumerable`1 damageModifiers) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.GameRules.WeaponInfo+<Impact>c__AnonStorey2.<>m__0 () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.GameRules.WeaponInfo.Impact (Target target, OpenRA.Actor firedBy, IEnumerable`1 damageModifiers) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Effects.Missile.Explode (OpenRA.World world) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Effects.Missile.Tick (OpenRA.World world) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.World.<Tick>m__4 (IEffect e) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.WorldUtils.DoTimed[IEffect] (IEnumerable`1 e, System.Action`1 a, System.String text) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.World.Tick () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.InnerLogicTick (OpenRA.Network.OrderManager orderManager) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.LogicTick () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.Loop () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.Run () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Program.Run (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
```

I got this two times in a row. In the first case I also got Ubuntu crash report win mono SIGENV when accessing address 0x0 when creating new thread. I got this segfault also once when I was exiting the game but I'm not sure about the circumstances.

Please let me know if I should submit the remaining log files.

data.title: Fix an invalid owner init entry in nod05.
ctrl+backspace doesn't delete last word in chat
data.body: In the lobby as well as in-game, `ctrl`+`backspace` (or its osx equivalent) doesn't remove the last word when chatting. It's useful in case the user wants to just quickly clear the text (or the last n words).

data.title: Rank effect moved to new trait
data.body:
`Rank` effect moved to new trait that implements `IRender`.

Third item in #7551
Prerequisite for #7585 (PR #8210)

data.title: Distinguish between all map cells and cells inside map bounds.
data.body:
This is the next step towards scripted map bounds changes (for missions), and makes the next set of shroud changes a bit cleaner.

The original `Map.Cells` has been renamed to `Map.CellsInsideBounds`, and should be used for anything that cares about the _current_ map state.  `Map.AllCells` covers the entire map (including the cordon cells), and should be used when initializing map state.
